prompt: Which of the following is not a task your operating system performs?
feedback: Your operating system performs many tasks that make it possible to interact with your computer. It prioritizes tasks for the computer, organizing what needs to be done... It communicates with your software, so the computer can understand what needs to be done... It provides a way for you to organize your files. And these are only a few tasks that the operating system does. One thing it doesn’t do is determine how much RAM your computer has. The RAM is part of your computer’s hardware... the operating system helps determine how the RAM is used, but it doesn’t determine how much RAM you have.
